util module¶

util.py

This file contains utility functions for the planning.py script

@author: Mitch Albert

Revision History:
MA: 2023-02-09: Initial version

Added get_file() Added get_files()

MA: 2023-02-16: Added save_file()

Added get_user_selection()

MA: 2023-02-20: Added get_files_from_dir() MA: 2023-03-23: Added print ulitity functions

Added progress functions Added Load files function

util.get_file(f_types: tuple[str, str] | list[tuple[str, str]] = [('Shapefile', '*.shp'), ('GeoPackage ', '*.gpkg'), ('All files', '*.*')], title: str = 'Select File To Load', initialdir='C:\\Users\\Mitch\\Documents\\OneDrive\\3rd\\Winter\\GEOM4009A\\GroupProject\\planningproj\\docs') → str[source]¶

Open a tkinter file dialog for a user to selelect a single file to load. Uses get_files() to do the heavy lifting, but passes the multi=False to limit the user to selecting a single file. Author: Mitch Albert

Parameters:

  • f_types (tuple[str, str] | list[tuple[str, str]], optional) – The file type(s) allowed, defaults to ft_standard.

  • title (str, optional) – Title of the dialog box, defaults to “Select File To Load”

  • initialdir (str, optional) – The directory the window will open to, defaults to getcwd().

Returns:

A str that is pathlike, or None if cancel is selected.

Return type:

str

util.get_files(f_types: tuple[str, str] | list[tuple[str, str]] = [('Shapefile', '*.shp'), ('GeoPackage ', '*.gpkg'), ('All files', '*.*')], title: str = 'Select Files To Load', initialdir: str = 'C:\\Users\\Mitch\\Documents\\OneDrive\\3rd\\Winter\\GEOM4009A\\GroupProject\\planningproj\\docs', multi: bool = True) → List[str][source]¶

Open a tkinter file dialog for a user to selelect file(s) to load. Author: Mitch Albert

Parameters:

  • f_types (tuple[str, str] | list[tuple[str, str]], optional) – The file type(s) allowed, defaults to ft_standard.

  • title (str, optional) – Title of dialog box, defaults to “Select Files To Load”

  • initialdir (str, optional) – The initial directory dialog box open to, defaults to getcwd().

  • multi (bool, optional) – Enables or disables multiple file selection, defaults to True.

Returns:

A list of str’s that is pathlike, or None if cancel is selected.

Return type:

List[str]

util.get_files_from_dir(f_types: tuple[str, str] | list[tuple[str, str]] = ('All files', '*.*'), title: str = 'Select Directory To Load Files From', initialdir: str = 'C:\\Users\\Mitch\\Documents\\OneDrive\\3rd\\Winter\\GEOM4009A\\GroupProject\\planningproj\\docs') → List[str][source]¶

Open a tkinter file dialog for a user to selelect a directory. All contained files matching the filter will be returned. Author: Mitch Albert

Parameters:

  • f_types (tuple[str, str] | list[tuple[str, str]], optional) – The file type(s) allowed, defaults to ft_any.

  • title (str, optional) – Title of the dialog box, defaults to “Select Directory To Load Files From”.

  • initialdir (str, optional) – The initial directory to open the dialog box in, defaults to getcwd().

Returns:

A list of strings that are pathlike, or None if cancel is selected or no files are found that match the filter.

Return type:

List[str]

util.get_save_file_name(f_types: tuple[str, str] | list[tuple[str, str]] = [('Comma-separated values', '*.csv'), ('Shapefile', '*.shp')], title: str = 'Save File', initialdir: str = 'C:\\Users\\Mitch\\Documents\\OneDrive\\3rd\\Winter\\GEOM4009A\\GroupProject\\planningproj\\docs') → str[source]¶

Open a tkinter file dialog for the user to indicate where and what to save a file as. Author: Mitch Albert

Parameters:

  • f_types (tuple[str, str] | list[tuple[str, str]], optional) – The file type(s) allowed, defaults to ft_standard_save.

  • title (str, optional) – Title of dialog box, defaults to “Save File”.

  • initialdir (str, optional) – The initial directory dialog box open to, defaults to getcwd()

Returns:

A str that is pathlike, or None if cancel is selected.

Return type:

str

util.get_top_root() → Tk[source]¶

Create an invisible root window that has been forced to top and into focus. Author: Mitch Albert

Returns:

The invisible top level root window.

Return type:

Tk

util.get_user_float(msg: str) → float[source]¶

Get a float from the user. If the user enters a non-float value, the function will continue to prompt the user until a valid float is entered. Author: Mitch Albert

Parameters:

msg (str) – The message to display to the user.

Returns:

The user’s input as a float.

Return type:

float

util.get_user_selection(item_list: list[any], multi: bool = False, title: str = 'Please Make A Selection', x: int = 400, y: int = 600, bg: str = '#5ea5c9') → list[any][source]¶

Open a Tkinter window with the given list of items to select from. Selction can be single or multiple. Author: Mitch Albert

Parameters:

  • item_list (list[any]) – The list representing the items to select from.

  • multi (bool, optional) – Determines whether multiple selections are allowed or not, defaults to False.

  • title (str, optional) – The title of the Tkinter window, defaults to “Please Make A Selection”.

  • x (int, optional) – The width of the Tkinter window, defaults to 400

  • y (int, optional) – The height of the Tkinter window, defaults to 600

  • bg (str, optional) – The background color of the Tkinter window, defaults to “#5ea5c9”

Returns:

A list of selected items, or an empty list if none are selected. If multi is False, the list can contain only one item.

Return type:

list[any]

util.load_files(files: list[str] | str, verbose: str = True) → list[geopandas.geodataframe.GeoDataFrame] | GeoDataFrame[source]¶

Load a list of files into a list of GeoDataFrames. If a single file name is passed that is not is a list, the function will return a single GeoDataFrame not inside a list. If a list of files is passed, even if it only contains 1 file, the function will return a list. Author: Mitch Albert

Parameters:

  • files (list[str] | str) – The list of file names to load, or a single file name.

  • verbose (str, optional) – Controls whether the function prints progress messages and file information, defaults to True.

Returns:

A list of geodataframes if a list was passed in or a single geodataframe if a single file name was passed in.

Return type:

list[gpd.GeoDataFrame] | gpd.GeoDataFrame

util.print_error_msg(msg: str) → None[source]¶

Print an error message to the terminal. The message is printed in red with the “ERROR: “ prefix. Author: Mitch Albert

Parameters:

msg (str) – The message to print.

util.print_info(msg: str) → None[source]¶

Print an information message to the terminal. The message is printed in blue with the “INFO: “ prefix. Author: Mitch Albert :param msg: The message to print. :type msg: str

util.print_info_complete(msg: str) → None[source]¶

Print an information message to the terminal. The message is printed in green with the “INFO: “ prefix. Used to indicate that a process has completed successfully. Author: Mitch Albert

Parameters:

msg (str) – The message to print.

util.print_msg(msg: str, colour: str = '', msg_type: str = '') → None[source]¶

Print a message to the terminal. The message is printed in the colour specified with the colour parameter. The msg_type parameter is printed before the message. This is used by the other print utility functions to print different types of messages with the same general format. Author: Mitch Albert

Parameters:

  • msg (str) – The message to print.

  • colour (str, optional) – The colour to print the message in, defaults to “”.

  • msg_type (str, optional) – The message type to print before the message, defaults to “”.

util.print_progress_start(msg: str = 'Processing data', dots: int = 10, time: float = 1) → Thread[source]¶

Provide a progress indicator in the terminal. The progress indicator is a the msg string followed by a series of dots. The dots are printed at a rate of time seconds per dot. The number of dots is controlled by the dots parameter. Author: Mitch Albert

Parameters:

  • msg (str, optional) – The msg string is printed before the dots, defaults to msg_processing.

  • dots (int, optional) – The number of dots to prints before resetting back to the message string, defaults to 10.

  • time (float, optional) – The time in seconds between each dot, defaults to 1

Returns:

The progress thread handle. This is required to stop the progress indicator.

Return type:

threading.Thread

util.print_progress_stop(thread: Thread) → None[source]¶

Stop the progress indicator thread, using the thread handle returned by print_progress_start(). Author: Mitch Albert

Parameters:

thread (threading.Thread) – The thread handle returned by the print_progress_start() function.

util.print_warning_msg(msg: str) → None[source]¶

Print a warning message to the terminal. The message is printed in yellow with the “WARNING: “ prefix. Author: Mitch Albert

Parameters:

msg (The message to print.) – _description_

util.save_gdf(gdf: GeoDataFrame) → None[source]¶

Save a GeoDataFrame to a file. The user is prompted to select a file name and file type. The file type is determined by the file extension. The supported file types are shapefile and geopackage. Author: Mitch Albert

Parameters:

gdf (gpd.GeoDataFrame) – The GeoDataFrame to save.
